item.title: Drifter-derived seasonal climatology of Sea surface temperature in the Tropical Indian Ocean
item.description: The study of sea surface temperature (SST) is one of the cornerstone of oceanography. It has applications not only in physics (Bader & Latif, 2003), chemistry (Corrège, 2006) and the earth’s sciences, but in subjects as diverse as biology and economics. SST plays an important role in our quantitative understanding of coastal habitats and species distribution in our global oceans (Grémillet et al., 2008; Müller-Karger, Walsh, Evans, & Meyers, 1991).
